verses.text: And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*; and the \sc Lord\sc* delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.
And there was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name \add was\add* Manoah; and his wife \add was\add* barren, and bare not.
And the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* appeared unto the woman, and said unto her, Behold now, thou \add art\add* barren, and bearest not: but thou shalt conceive, and bear a son.
Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean \add thing:\add*

for lo, thou \add shalt\add* conceive, and bear a son; and no rasor shall come on his head: for the child shall be a Nazarite unto God from the womb: and he shall begin to deliver Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.

Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, A man of God came unto me, and his countenance \add was\add* like the countenance of an angel of God, very terrible: but I asked him not whence he \add was\add*, neither told he me his name:

but he said unto me, Behold, thou \add shalt\add* conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, neither eat any unclean \add thing:\add* for the child shall be a Nazarite to God from the womb to the day of his death.
Then Manoah intreated the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, O my Lord, let the man of God which thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the child that shall be born.
And God hearkened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again unto the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah her husband \add was\add* not with her.
And the woman made haste, and ran, and shewed her husband, and said unto him, Behold, the man hath appeared unto me, that came unto me the \add other\add* day.
And Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said unto him, \add Art\add* thou the man that spakest unto the woman? And he said, I \add am\add*.
And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass. How shall we order the child, and \add how\add* shall we do unto him?
And the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Manoah, Of all that I said unto the woman let her beware.
She may not eat of any \add thing\add* that cometh of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean \add thing:\add* all that I commanded her let her observe.
And Manoah said unto the angel of the \sc Lord\sc*, I pray thee, let us detain thee, until we shall have made ready a kid for thee.

And the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Manoah, Though thou detain me, I will not eat of thy bread: and if thou wilt offer a burnt offering, thou must offer it unto the \sc Lord\sc*. For Manoah knew not that he \add was\add* an angel of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And Manoah said unto the angel of the \sc Lord\sc*, What \add is\add* thy name, that when thy sayings come to pass we may do thee honour?
And the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* said unto him, Why askest thou thus after my name, seeing it \add is\add* secret?
So Manoah took a kid with a meat offering, and offered \add it\add* upon a rock unto the \sc Lord\sc*: and \add the angel\add* did wondrously; and Manoah and his wife looked on.

For it came to pass, when the flame went up toward heaven from off the altar, that the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* ascended in the flame of the altar. And Manoah and his wife looked on \add it\add*, and fell on their faces to the ground.
But the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* did no more appear to Manoah and to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he \add was\add* an angel of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And Manoah said unto his wife, We shall surely die, because we have seen God.

But his wife said unto him, If the \sc Lord\sc* were pleased to kill us, he would not have received a burnt offering and a meat offering at our hands, neither would he have shewed us all these \add things\add*, nor would as \add at this\add* time have told us \add such things\add* as these.
And the woman bare a son, and called his name Samson: and the child grew, and the \sc Lord\sc* blessed him.
And the spirit of the \sc Lord\sc* began to move him at times in the camp of Dan between Zorah and Eshtaol.
